translation.en: [man's voice echoes] Why?
[man sighs deeply] Oh, why?
Mehmed.
Mother Mara, what are you doing here at this hour?
Looking for you.
[Mara] How long has it been since you've slept?
[exhales] Two, three days?
I don't know.
What troubles you?
I've seen Vlad Dracula.
Here? In the palace?
No.
In my dreams.
Terrible dreams.
[Mehmed] This is madness.
Why are you doing this?
You destroyed my family.
No! I protected you like a brother.
Lies!
All you have done is take from me.
-No more! -[cannon thunders]
Your hatred blinds you, Vlad.
Walk away now, and I will spare you.
Wallachia will be your grave.
You will die alone.
The Sufi said my dreams were visions of the future.
I pray this is no omen.
[narrator] Eight years after Mehmed II's epic conquest of Constantinople,
he is no longer derided as the "Boy Sultan."
Mehmed is now the most powerful ruler in the East,
and the most feared in the West.
[man] Europe had good cause to be worried about him.
translation.ko: 메흐메트는 유럽에 근심을 줄 만한 인물이었죠

translation.en: He's fulfilled the prophecy of the Prophet Muhammad.
He's conquered this city that people thought was unconquerable,
and he has defeated the Roman Empire.
He starts to set his eyes gradually on moving towards
translation.ko: 그리고 최초의 로마이자 원래의 로마를 향해

translation.en: the first Rome, the original Rome.
There are accounts from Italians visiting Mehmed's court
who talk about him desiring to advance
translation.ko: 동방을 정벌한 알렉산더 대왕처럼 서방으로 진출하려는

translation.en: as far west as Alexander the Great had advanced east.
translation.ko: 메흐메트의 욕망을 기록으로 남겼습니다 "헝가리 - 로마 오스만 제국"

translation.en: And so, Italy was always on the agenda.
translation.ko: 그래서 이탈리아는 늘 논의 대상이 됐습니다

translation.en: After the conquest of Constantinople, Mehmed took the title Kayser-i Rum,
translation.ko: 콘스탄티노플을 정복한 메흐메트는 '카이세르 이 룸'을 자처했습니다

translation.en: Caesar of the Romans,
so no doubt about what his intentions were.
translation.ko: 그러니 무슨 의도였는지 의심할 나위가 없어요

translation.en: [narrator] In preparation for his eventual advance westward,
Mehmed has assembled a vast web of spies throughout the courts of Europe.
translation.ko: 메흐메트는 온 유럽 궁정에 첩자를 뿌렸다

translation.en: [man 1] Sultan, the word from Rome is
that the Pope is raising a crusade against you as we speak.
He calls you the "Red Dragon of the Apocalypse."
Florentine snake. Apologize at once.
Childish taunts from a man with a silly hat.
[man 1] Their position is quite clear, Sultan.
If you invade Europe, all of Christendom will rise up against you.
translation.ko: 유럽을 침공하시면 기독교 세계 전체가 맞설 겁니다

translation.en: Like they did at Constantinople.
And who will lead this mighty Christian army against me?
translation.ko: 그 막강한 기독교 군대는 누가 이끌지?

translation.en: There hasn't been a great warrior among them since Hunyadi's death.
translation.ko: 후냐디가 죽은 후에 대단한 전사가 없었어

translation.en: There is one ruler who has the ear of the Pope these days.
translation.ko: 요즘 교황의 관심을 끄는 통치자가 있습니다

translation.en: He brags that he knows how to fight the Ottomans and win.
translation.ko: 오스만 제국과 싸워서 이기는 법을 안다고 자랑하죠

translation.en: [scoffs] Surely this ruler has a name.
Vlad Dracula.
I taught Vlad how to fight when he was a little boy.
translation.ko: 블라드가 어릴 때 제가 무술을 가르쳤습니다

translation.en: He is fearless,
but he is not suitable enough to start a war between us.
Have you confirmed this information?
Grand Vizier, they are just rumors… for now.
But Prince Vlad has recently visited the king in Buda.
translation.ko: 하지만 최근에 블라드 대공이 헝가리 왕을 만났습니다

translation.en: The prince should choose his friends more carefully.
[narrator] Raised in the Ottoman court with Mehmed,
translation.ko: 메흐메트와 함께 오스만 궁에서 자란 블라드 대공은

translation.en: Vlad Dracula is voivode, or ruler of Wallachia,
a vassal state and ally of the Ottomans located in present-day Romania,
translation.ko: 왈라키아는 오스만 제국의 번국이자 동맹으로 현재의 루마니아에 있었는데 "왈라키아 도나우강"

translation.en: but a kingdom that has notoriously shifted allegiance
between the Ottomans and Hungarians.
translation.ko: 편을 자주 바꾸기로 악명이 높았다 "헝가리 - 흑해 오스만 제국"

translation.en: [Talbot] They are at the whim essentially of the Ottomans and the Hungarians
translation.ko: 왈라키아는 주도권을 다투는 오스만 제국과 헝가리 사이에서

translation.en: in terms of who's in charge.
[man 2] Vlad Dracula is a very, very interesting character
because he's really caught between these two superpowers.
They've got the Ottoman Empire coming strongly through the Balkans,
translation.ko: 오스만 제국은 발칸 반도를 넘어오고 있었고

translation.en: and also you've got the Hungarians.
They're the champions of Catholic Europe,
and they want Dracula to remain their buffer against the Ottomans.
translation.ko: 드라큘라가 오스만 제국을 막는 방파제가 되길 바랐습니다

translation.en: He's very difficult to control, but he's still really important to them.
He is a bogeyman.
He is a bête noire.
He is the guy that we can release
because his reputation for fierce warfare precedes him,
and he is one of the terrors of the age.
[man 3] He fought the Ottomans, the Hungarians, and the Moldavians.
translation.ko: 블라드는 오스만 제국, 헝가리 몰다비아와 싸웠습니다

translation.en: He fought everybody around him.
He's considered by Romanian population
as one of the greatest voivodes that ever existed.
For the rest of the world, he is known as Dracula, the bloodthirsty vampire,
due to a 19th century Irish guy, who had some time on his hands
and wrote a novel
because it seems that he loved impaling people.
translation.ko: 블라드가 사람 꿰뚫는 걸 좋아하는 것처럼 묘사했거든요

translation.en: [narrator] The real Vlad Dracula, also known as Vlad Tepes, "The Impaler,"
takes the throne in Wallachia in 1456
by killing his predecessor in a duel
and beheading another rival after forcing him to dig his own grave.
translation.ko: 다른 경쟁자는 제 무덤을 파고 참수당하게 했다

translation.en: Vlad is extremely bloodthirsty and cruel, even in medieval standards.
translation.ko: 블라드는 중세 기준으로도 피에 굶주리고 잔인했어요

translation.en: He grew up in a very war-like society.
So having grown up under these really, uh, it's…
really tenuous circumstances, he developed this very dark personality.
translation.ko: 이렇게 열악한 환경에서 자라며 성격이 어두워졌어요

translation.en: [narrator] In the midst of a bitter power struggle
with Wallachia's ruling class and kingmakers, the boyars,
translation.ko: 실력자, 보야르 귀족과 격렬한 권력 투쟁을 벌이던 중에 "트르고비슈테 왈라키아의 수도"

translation.en: Dracula hosts an Easter banquet
translation.ko: "트르고비슈테 왈라키아의 수도" 드라큘라는 부활절 연회를 열어

translation.en: to settle matters with his political rivals once and for all.
translation.ko: 경쟁자들과 얽힌 문제를 완전히 해결하고자 한다

translation.en: My esteemed countrymen,
my wife, Anastasia, and I are honored to celebrate Easter with you.
translation.ko: 여러분과 부활절을 축하하니 우리 부부의 영광이오

translation.en: Just as Christ was resurrected,
so too have the fortunes of the House of Drăculeşti been resurrected,
bringing with them a prosperous and independent Wallachia.
A new day is upon us.
We have the Hungarians' respect.
And we will no longer pay the sultan's tax.
translation.ko: 더는 술탄에게 세금을 내지 않을 것이오

translation.en: Prince, we must be wise.
Much of our trade is with the Ottomans,
and we enjoy the protection of the sultan's army.
This is a celebration.
-[guests laughing] -[Vlad] There will be time for politics.
Later.
To my husband, Prince Vlad.
[guests] Long live Prince Vlad! Long live Prince Vlad!
-To God… -[guest cheers fade]
…destiny…
my lovely wife,
and, of course, you.
You scheming, backstabbing swine.
You are the real enemy of Wallachia.
Did you think I would forget how you betrayed my father and brother?
translation.ko: 너희가 내 아버지와 형을 배신한 걸 잊을 줄 알았나?

translation.en: How you conspired with my foes, growing fat and rich!
Dimitrie, make sure this lesson sticks with our guests.
translation.ko: 디미트리에, 손님들을 제대로 혼쭐 내 줘라

translation.en: [Dimitrie] Yes.
[Waterson] Each of the boyars and their wives are taken outside.
They are impaled.
Unfortunately, we know a little too much about the mechanics of impalement.
translation.ko: 불행히도 꼬챙이형의 과정은 너무나 잘 알려져 있습니다

translation.en: It's not pleasant.
[man 1] Someone help me. I'll give you my rings. Please!
translation.ko: 누구든 살려 주게 이 반지를 줄 테니 제발!

translation.en: [man 2] It's a horrific method of execution.
You take a stake that's not very sharp and you push it up the anus of the victim.
translation.ko: 예리하지 않은 말뚝으로 희생자의 항문을 찌릅니다

translation.en: [man 1 pleading] No! No! No!
[man 2] And then you use a mallet,
push it all the way up until it comes out of the shoulder.
translation.ko: 어깨로 나올 때까지 말뚝을 밀어 올려요

translation.en: And if you get a master executioner,
he will avoid most of the vital organs,
and then you're gonna fix it in the ground, and let the person die.
translation.ko: 말뚝을 땅에 고정해서 희생자가 죽게 놔둘 겁니다

translation.en: The master of this was… [laughs] …Vlad the Impaler.
translation.ko: 블라드 가시공은 이런 일에 도가 텄습니다

translation.en: [Waterson] To be fair to him, with the Easter Massacre,
there is evidence of a conspiracy that they're going to depose him.
translation.ko: 귀족들이 블라드를 몰아내려고 공모한 증거는 있습니다

translation.en: [Pogăciaş] He had seen all these rivalries and all these plots
translation.ko: 블라드는 적법한 통치자를 죽이고 다른 이를 옹립하려는

translation.en: that were meant to kill the rightful ruler and impose somebody else.
Vlad's father is killed by the boyars.
His older brother, Mircea, is tortured and then buried alive by the boyars.
I don't think he was a madman.
It's just politics.
[Talbot] This is the time really
when Vlad starts to get his reputation as "Vlad the Impaler,"
and it's one of those names that does what it says on the tin.
So this is part of his identity as a ruler,
as well as a technique for maintaining control.
If he can show that despite his size,
he's the meanest kid on the block,
translation.ko: 내가 이 동네 악동인 걸 드러내면

translation.en: even though there's bigger boys next door, they're not going to pick on him.
translation.ko: 옆집에 덩치 큰 애가 있어도 감히 시비를 걸지 않겠죠

translation.en: Let this be a warning to all of our enemies.
I'll bend my knee for no one.
[narrator] The rotting bodies lining the road to Târgovişte
translation.ko: 트르고비슈테로 가는 길에 썩은 시체가 늘어서고

translation.en: and growing rumors of Vlad's betrayal
sends a defiant and highly personal message to Mehmed II.
translation.ko: 메흐메트 2세는 블라드의 반항과 개인적 감정을 느낀다

translation.en: Dracula's loyalty to the man he grew up with is waning.
translation.ko: 성장기를 함께 보낸 드라큘라의 충성심이 사라지고 있었다

translation.en: Adding further intrigue to the hostilities brewing between Mehmed and Vlad
translation.ko: 메흐메트와 블라드의 대립을 더욱 흥미롭게 만든 것은 "이스탄불 외곽"

translation.en: is Dracula's younger brother, Radu.
He, too, was raised in the Ottoman court,
but still remains part of the sultan's inner circle.
[Mehmed] I've received troubling news from my Italian spy.
The Florentine had much to say.
Your brother openly brags to the Pope that he knows how to defeat me in battle.
translation.ko: 네 형이 날 이길 수 있다고 교황에게 장담한다더군

translation.en: There's even talk of him joining a Hungarian-backed Crusade against us.
translation.ko: 헝가리가 지원하는 십자군에 가담했다는 얘기도 있어

translation.en: Like your father.
Vlad is not my father.
No, he's more dangerous.
Life would be much easier if you ruled Wallachia instead of Vlad.
translation.ko: 네가 왈라키아를 다스렸다면 걱정이 줄었을 거다

translation.en: He's unpredictable.
-And you, dear Radu, you are… -Predictable.
Vlad has always been a braggart,
but it's only words.
Perhaps.
Has he written you?
Not for a while.
[Mehmed] There are some in Europe who might see my patience with him
translation.ko: 블라드에 대한 내 인내심을 유럽에서 약점으로 보고

translation.en: as weakness and become emboldened.
That cannot happen.
Vlad has forgotten his place,
and I will not allow him to get in the way of my plans in the West.
Vlad swore an oath to you, Mehmed.
He is only seeking attention.
And now he has it.
He only sits on that throne today because of my protection.
translation.ko: 블라드가 떵떵거리는 건 내가 보호하기 때문이야

translation.en: Free to run his country as he chooses because of me.
translation.ko: 나라를 맘대로 다스리는 것도 내 덕이야

translation.en: Yet, refuses to come to Istanbul and pay his yearly homage and tribute?
translation.ko: 그런데도 이스탄불에 안 오고 존경과 연공을 바치길 거부해?

translation.en: -He's proud. -While he holds court
with our enemies in Hungary.
I've already sent the messengers…
to summon him to Istanbul to prove to me he is still an ally and friend.
translation.ko: 이스탄불에 올라와 우호와 우정을 증명하라고 했다

translation.en: I expect him to come at once.
And if he refuses?
That would be unwise.
You wouldn't want to be little brother to Vlad.
And you wouldn't want to be stuck between Mehmed II and Vlad Dracula.
translation.ko: 메흐메트 2세와 블라드 사이에 끼는 것도 곤란했죠

translation.en: Eh, so, he… he also found himself not in a very nice position.
translation.ko: 라두는 자기 처지가 썩 좋지 않은 걸 깨닫습니다

translation.en: [Talbot] Radu is known by this nickname as "Radu the Fair" or "Radu the Handsome,"
but he's also someone clearly who has a canny political mind.
He's a bit of a culture vulture,
and he likes the Ottoman way of doing things,
but Radu maintains his Wallachian-ness.
It must have been difficult to be trapped between these two big personalities.
translation.ko: 두 거물 사이에 끼어서 힘들었을 거예요

translation.en: [Vlad] My dearest brother, as you have ignored my last three letters,
translation.ko: 사랑하는 아우야 내 편지를 세 통이나 무시해서

translation.en: I'm writing to you once again
in the hope that you will honor the promise you made to me years ago
translation.ko: 네가 몇 년 전에 한 약속을 지키고

translation.en: and return to your true home
in Wallachia.
The hour is rapidly approaching when we must take up arms
against those that have had their boot on our throat for far too long.
translation.ko: 맞서야 할 시간이 빠르게 다가오고 있다

translation.en: Family is the dearest gift we possess.
Loyalty is everything.
Stand ready.
-With great affection… -[quill scratching] …your brother, Vlad.
[narrator] The seeds of Vlad Dracula's betrayal were sown 20 years earlier
translation.ko: 블라드가 배신하는 계기는 20년 전으로 거슬러 올라간다

translation.en: when his own father, Vlad II, was called before Mehmed's father,
Sultan Murad II, amidst rumors that he'd joined the Hungarians
and taken up arms against the Ottomans.
translation.ko: 오스만에 맞선다는 소문을 듣고 그를 소환한다

translation.en: Sultan, I'm sorry to interrupt your hunt,
but when I received your summons, I made all haste to reach you.
You have been a most loyal friend and ally to me all these years.
I wish I could say the same of you,
Vlad Dracul.
[Vlad II] There are some rumors of my alliance with the Hungarians
in the coming crusade against you,
but I can assure you they're only that, rumors.
The Hungarians are snakes and not to be trusted.
translation.ko: 헝가리인은 뱀 같아서 믿을 수 없다

translation.en: If I go to war against you,
take solace that I will kill you honorably.
Face-to-face.
Not with a knife in the back.
[Vlad II] Sultan, you must believe me.
What guarantee do I have that you won't return home
translation.ko: 네가 고개를 푹 숙이고 고향으로 돌아가서

translation.en: with your tail between your legs,
only to join the infidels and take up arms against me?
As proof of my undying loyalty,
I give you my most valued possessions,
my sons, Vlad, and my youngest, Radu.
Father, how can you do this?
Silence, boy!
Prince Vlad, Prince Radu.
As sultan,
I accept your care-taking as my prisoners.
From this moment forward, your loyalty will forever be to me,
and one day, to my son, Mehmed.
Should your father betray his oath,
you will be executed.
Thank you, Sultan.
This is royal hostage taking.
These are two young boys taken from their family homes,
translation.ko: 두 소년은 가족이 있는 고향에서 떨어져

translation.en: cut of all familial ties and correspondence,
and now having to potentially worry about this foreign court strangling you
translation.ko: 아버지가 잘못하면 타국 궁정에서 죽게 된다는

translation.en: if your father does anything wrong.
They were pawns within a wider game.
[Vlad] One day, I will return for you.
It is a terrible game, you know.
It's full of traumatizing events. It's full of betrayals,
translation.ko: 마음의 상처와 배신감이 철철 넘치는 일이었죠

translation.en: and I think Vlad is a prime example
what kind of a toll that life could take on a human psychology.
translation.ko: 심리적 영향을 드러내는 대표적 인물이라고 봅니다

translation.en: [narrator] Two decades later, Mehmed, like his father, Murad II,
finds himself facing a potential rebellion from the House of Drăculeşti.
He sends emissaries to the Wallachian capital
to demand that Vlad pay his debt to the sultan.
As a vassal state, Vlad had to be loyal to the Ottomans.
translation.ko: 블라드는 속국의 군주로서 오스만 제국에 충성해야 했어요

translation.en: He had to take his army to fight alongside the Ottoman army,
wherever this was needed.
And of course, the most important part, to pay his tribute every year.
translation.ko: 가장 중요한 의무는 연공을 바치는 일이었어요

translation.en: This was the thing that kept you in the house of peace.
This is what a gold coin would look like
at the end of the 15th century.
Very small, but pure gold pretty much,
and Vlad's expected to pay 2,000 of these every year,
translation.ko: 블라드는 이런 걸 2천 닢씩 매년 내야 했지만

translation.en: but he clearly hasn't
because Mehmed, um, sends some ambassadors to demand
translation.ko: 메흐메트는 사절을 보내서 5년 치 체납금에 해당하는 1만 닢을 갚으라고 독촉했습니다

translation.en: 10,000 gold coins of payment, which would be five years' worth of back payment,
translation.ko: 5년 치 체납금에 해당하는 1만 닢을 갚으라고 독촉했습니다

translation.en: so that shows us that pretty much since he's established himself as a ruler in Wallachia,
translation.ko: 이를 통해 블라드가 왈라키아에서 통치력을 확보한 이래로

translation.en: Vlad's not been doing his homage to the Ottoman sultan.
translation.ko: 오스만 술탄을 무시했다는 걸 알 수 있습니다

translation.en: The fact that he refuses to do that is what causes his problems with Mehmed.
translation.ko: 블라드가 의무 이행을 거부하면서 메흐메트와 문제가 생겼어요

translation.en: Welcome to Târgovişte.
I trust your journey was not too long, Pashas.
translation.ko: 너무 긴 여정은 아니었길 바란다 파샤들이여

translation.en: -[emissary] Thank you, Prince Vlad. -[bored grunt]
Mehmed II, Conqueror, Ruler of Two Lands, Ruler of Two Seas,
translation.ko: 두 대륙과 두 바다의 지배자 로마 황제, 술탄 중의 술탄인

translation.en: Caesar of Rome, and Sultan of Sultans, sends his greetings.
I'm sure the Sultan of Sultans
didn't send you all this way just to bring me Turkish delight.
translation.ko: 튀르크 과자나 주려고 그대를 여기 보낸 건 아니겠지

translation.en: -Prince Vlad, the sultan requests-- -[Vlad shushes]
[Vlad] I will save you the trouble.
Mehmed wants me to come to the capital,
pay what he thinks I owe him, and bend the knee.
translation.ko: 자기가 말하는 빚을 갚고 굴복하길 원해

translation.en: A show of loyalty.
But loyalty works both ways.
Does it not?
Lately, there have been rumors about your allegiance.
translation.ko: 대공의 충성심에 관한 소문이 최근에 돌고 있습니다

translation.en: You dare question the prince's loyalty.
Easy.
[Vlad] My kingdom's fortune has been spent
defending the sultan's borders against the Hungarians and others
translation.ko: 헝가리인과 다른 자들한테서 술탄의 변경을 지키느라

translation.en: who are wary of his adventures.
Wallachia's coffers are empty.
But you have sworn an oath to pay tribute.
This was made very clear when our sultan allowed you to take your throne.
translation.ko: 술탄께서 대공의 즉위를 허락할 때 확약한 내용입니다

translation.en: "Allowed me"?
"Allowed me."
The sultan has been very lenient because of your longstanding friendship.
translation.ko: 술탄께서 지금껏 관대하신 건 대공이 오랜 친구이기 때문입니다

translation.en: [Vlad] We have friendships in Europe as well.
Leaders who say it is high time that I have a seat at the table.
translation.ko: 그 친구들은 내가 너무 늦게 권력을 잡았다고 하더군

translation.en: They treat me with respect.
You speak of homage,
yet I noticed that none of you had the courtesy to remove your hats
translation.ko: 내 궁정에 들어올 때 예의를 갖춰서

translation.en: when you're entering my court.
Prince, you spent years in our court.
translation.ko: 대공, 우리 궁정에서 몇 년을 사셨잖습니까

translation.en: You know that Ottoman culture forbids us from removing our hats in public.
translation.ko: 공공장소에서 모자를 벗는 건 오스만 문화의 금기입니다

translation.en: But you're in my court now.
It seems we're at an impasse…
but I have a solution.
Mehmed can find a new ally…
and you'll never have to remove your hats again.
translation.ko: 그러면 모자를 또 벗을 일이 없을 거다

translation.en: You don't shoot the messenger in the Mongolian and Turkish tradition.
translation.ko: 몽골과 튀르크 전통에서는 사신을 벌하지 않아요

translation.en: These ambassadors are the symbol of Mehmed.
To mistreat an Ottoman ambassador is to mistreat Mehmed himself.
translation.ko: 오스만 사신에 대한 모욕은 메흐메트에 대한 모욕이었죠

translation.en: So, this is sending as big a message to Mehmed as Vlad possibly could.
translation.ko: 블라드는 메흐메트에게 확실한 메시지를 보낸 겁니다

translation.en: The message was clear. He was no longer in the house of peace.
translation.ko: 메시지는 분명했어요 블라드는 평화를 원치 않았고

translation.en: He was crossing to the house of war.
Does he think I will ignore this?
You did ignore him for years,
allowing his tribute to go unpaid.
And now that he has the backing of the Hungarians and the Pope,
he doesn't fear you.
I treated him as a brother when his own father abandoned him.
translation.ko: 그자가 아비한테서 버림받을 때 저는 형제처럼 대했어요

translation.en: Mehmed, forget that boy who showed up on our doorstep all those years ago.
translation.ko: 메흐메트, 오래전 이 궁에 왔던 아이는 잊어라

translation.en: He no longer exists.
Will staring holes in that map ease whatever troubles you?
translation.ko: 지도에 난 구멍을 보면 근심이 풀리나요?

translation.en: [narrator] Gulbahar Hatun is Mehmed's consort
and the mother of his son, Prince Bayezid II.
A new campaign?
I'm sending your father on a mission to Wallachia.
To see Prince Vlad?
It's true then.
Vlad has sided with the Hungarians.
Hamza Bey will bring Vlad back so that he can be punished.
translation.ko: 함자 베이가 블라드를 데려와서 처벌받게 할 거요

translation.en: Can't you send someone else?
Your father is the fiercest warrior I've ever known.
He also knows Vlad better than anyone in my court, even Radu.
translation.ko: 내 궁정에서는 라두보다도 블라드를 잘 아는 사람이오

translation.en: I know what happened to the emissaries.
Gulbahar, Hamza Bey will be back in time for Bayezid's birthday.
translation.ko: 굴바하르, 함자 베이가 바예지드의 생일에 맞춰 올 거요

translation.en: I promise.
[Talbot] The Ottomans decide that the best way to deal with this situation
translation.ko: 오스만 제국은 블라드를 납치하고 이스탄불에 강제로 데려와서

translation.en: is to snatch Vlad and bring him back forcibly to Istanbul to answer to Mehmed.
translation.ko: 메흐메트 앞에 대령하는 것을 최선책으로 삼았어요

translation.en: So, a plot is hatched that would involve two key figures from the Ottoman court.
translation.ko: 그래서 오스만 궁정의 핵심 인물 두 명을 중심으로 음모를 꾸밉니다

translation.en: The first is Greek guy, originally called "Thomas,"
who's baby face of the routine.
He's a bureaucrat. He's non-threatening.
So, he's gonna be the one who's gonna go into Vlad's court
and persuade him of the benefits of coming to speak to Mehmed, and to lure him out
translation.ko: 메흐메트를 알현할 때의 이점으로 블라드를 설득하여

translation.en: into the Wallachian countryside.
Meanwhile, the second part of the plan is going to be taken care of by Hamza.
translation.ko: 한편, 그다음 계획을 책임질 사람은 함자입니다

translation.en: He's been a comrade-in-arms of Mehmed's,
all the way back to the time of the conquest of Constantinople.
[in Turkish] Hello, Hamza Bey,
[in English] my old friend.
An unexpected surprise.
In some of the sources,
it's certainly stated that capture of Vlad Dracula was the intent.
Whilst maybe capture would have been an enjoyment,
translation.ko: 어쩌면 생포의 목적은 단순히 재미였을 수도 있어요

translation.en: I think dead or alive would have been
perfectly acceptable to the sultan at this point.
translation.ko: 블라드의 생사에 전혀 개의치 않았을 겁니다

translation.en: Hamza Bey, Prince, we are all old friends here.
translation.ko: 함자 베이, 대공 우리는 오랜 친구입니다

translation.en: I'm certain this misunderstanding with the sultan can be easily resolved, ha?
translation.ko: 술탄과의 오해는 쉽게 풀 수 있을 겁니다

translation.en: -"Misunderstanding"? -[Thomas] Yeah.
There is no misunderstanding.
Now we understand each other.
Teacher.
[in Romanian] The fact that in 1461, Mehmet had proposed
the meeting in Giurgiu through Thomas Katabolinos,
translation.ko: "미하이-플로린 하산 중세 사학자" 궁정 작가인 토머스 카타볼리노스와

translation.en: a writer at the Court,
and through Hamza, the falcon bearer,
shows that both the Ottoman side and the Wallachian side
were no longer willing, in fact, to reach peace, but to play.
translation.ko: 평화보다 대결을 추구했음을 알 수 있습니다

translation.en: [Talbot, in English] Vlad has his own network of spies,
so Vlad has set up his counter-trap to the original trap,
leaving him now with some valuable captives,
particularly in the form of Mehmed's comrade, Hamza.
[Vlad] What was that you told me when I was a boy?
Know your enemy as you know yourself.
You are a fool.
Mehmed will come after you.
[Vlad] And I'll be waiting for him.
But what shall we do about you?
Add this to our collection.
Bring these two with us.
Kill the rest!
Vlad, at this point, is one step ahead of the game.
[narrator] After ambushing Hamza Bey and Thomas Katabolinos,
Vlad launches a 500-mile raid into Ottoman-held Bulgaria,
killing thousands of men, women, and children.
"Fatih Sultan Mehmed, I was made aware
that you've been seeking an audience with me."
"Unfortunately, I must decline."
"From this day forward, know me as your enemy."
"You are a coward, hiding behind your army
and your walls, like Constantine before you."
"If you want to take Europe, you must defeat me."
"And we both know that will be the end of you."
translation.ko: '그러면 너는 끝난다는 걸 우리 둘 다 알지'

translation.en: [Hasan, in Romanian] Vlad said very clearly,
"By such a political gesture,
declare that all bridges between us are broken,
and I am waiting for you on my ground."
He sent Hamza Bey's prayer beads.
Vlad will die for this.
-[Mara] He is baiting you. -No, he is threatening me.
translation.ko: - 널 유인하는 거다 - 아뇨, 협박하는 거죠

translation.en: Sultan, let me lead your army into Wallachia
translation.ko: 술탄, 제가 군대를 이끌고 왈라키아로 가서

translation.en: and rid this arrogant fool of his head.
I should lead the sultan's army… -[scoffs] -…to restore my family's honor.
translation.ko: 내가 술탄의 군대를 이끌고 가문의 명예를 회복하겠소

translation.en: [man] Prince Radu, you have never led an army,
and I worry that when it comes down to it,
blood may be thicker than water.
-Meaning? -Meaning there's a streak of betrayal
translation.ko: 무슨 뜻이오? 왕자님 가문에는 술탄을 배신하는 기질이 있다는 뜻이죠

translation.en: through your family's dealings with the sultan.
translation.ko: 왕자님 가문에는 술탄을 배신하는 기질이 있다는 뜻이죠

translation.en: Enough!
I will lead my army.
This is between me and Vlad.
I will go to Wallachia,
and before I kill him, he will see me take the one thing he values above all else,
translation.ko: 놈을 죽이기 전에 가장 소중한 것을 빼앗겠다

translation.en: his beloved capital, Târgovişte.
My Sultan, your campaign in Corinth is just underway.
Send Mahmud Pasha to Wallachia in your stead.
-Mahmud Pasha. -[Mahmud] Sultan.
-Prince Radu. -[Radu] Sultan.
[Mehmed] Both of you will ride by my side.
And when I take Vlad's head, Radu, you will take the throne in Wallachia.
translation.ko: 라두, 블라드의 목이 날아가면 왈라키아의 왕좌는 네 것이다

translation.en: Mother Mara, I need you to depart for Buda at once.
The Hungarians respect you. I need to know their role in all of this.
translation.ko: 헝가리인은 어머니를 존중합니다 그들의 역할을 알아야겠어요

translation.en: [Waterson] Both men know the war was coming,
translation.ko: 두 사람 모두 전쟁이 임박했다는 걸 알지만

translation.en: but I think at this point, Mehmed begins to see two things.
translation.ko: 이 시점에 메흐메트는 두 가지에 주목한 것 같습니다

translation.en: One, that Wallachia is going to be a very tough nut to crack.
It favors the defender, the terrain.
He knows that he's got, uh,
translation.ko: 메흐메트 2세는 블라드 드라큘라가 호적수인 사실을 인지했어요

translation.en: a worthy adversary on the battlefield in Vlad Dracula,
but there's also a huge element of insult
about what has occurred leading up to this war.
translation.ko: 오스만이 당한 크나큰 모욕도 원인이 됐습니다

translation.en: [narrator] Mehmed assembles a massive army,
nearly the size of the one that conquered Constantinople.
His blood feud with Vlad Dracula has passed the point of no return.
translation.ko: 메흐메트와 블라드의 불화는 돌이킬 수 없는 지경에 이른다

translation.en: Meanwhile, in Hungary,
the Impaler Lord seeks out the one army in Europe
translation.ko: 블라드 가시공은 오스만 제국에 맞설 수 있는

translation.en: that can rival the Ottomans on the battlefield.
-Are those…? -[Vlad] Yes, King Matthias.
The noses and ears of every Turk and Bulgarian I killed
translation.ko: 제가 도나우강을 건널 때 죽인 튀르크인과 불가리아인의 코와 귀입니다

translation.en: when I crossed the Danube,
excluding those who were burned alive in their homes.
translation.ko: 산 채로 집에서 타 죽은 놈들은 제외했습니다

translation.en: [laughs] Yeah.
[Matthias] News of your successful campaign
against the Ottomans is already known in Europe.
translation.ko: 그대의 대오스만 작전이 성공했다는 소식은 이미 유럽에 알려졌네

translation.en: Though, not in such vivid detail.
The Pope himself has said,
"There is a great need for a man of your talents in the coming Crusade."
"Someone who knows how to fight Mehmed."
Have faith that I will kill the sultan.
But, King Matthias,
Mehmed's rage knows no bounds.
In the spring, he will come with evil intentions and all his power.
translation.ko: 봄이 오면 악의를 품고 전력을 다해 침공할 것입니다

translation.en: But once you and your mighty army
join forces with me…
the Great Turk's defeat is certain.
All in due time.
We shall send an envoy in the coming weeks with news of our plans.
translation.ko: 몇 주 안에 사절을 보내 우리 계획을 알리겠네

translation.en: [Waterson] Vlad says, very clearly,
"This is what we've done already to the Ottomans."
"I'm absolutely your man in the field."
And by the way,
here's two sacks of their noses and ears and heads for you to enjoy."
translation.ko: '코, 귀, 수급이 든 자루 두 개를 선물한다'

translation.en: Matthias Corvinus is using Vlad Dracula for what he can get out of him.
translation.ko: 마티아스는 원하는 걸 얻고자 블라드를 이용했어요

translation.en: The Hungarians treat Vlad like the Ottomans treat Vlad,
translation.ko: 헝가리가 블라드를 대한 방식은 오스만과 같았어요

translation.en: that he's part of a wider game of politics,
and they'll use him as long as he's useful,
and when he's no longer useful, then they'll leave him out to dry.
translation.ko: 쓸모가 있으면 이용하고 쓸모가 없으면 토사구팽할 생각이었어요

translation.en: [boy] Father, take me with you.
You'll join me on campaign soon enough.
translation.ko: 너도 곧 나를 따라 종군하게 될 거다

translation.en: But I've been training with the Janissaries.
My sword is sharp.
Your sword might be sharp, Bayezid, but you are not ready.
translation.ko: 예리하겠지, 바예지드 하지만 넌 준비가 안 됐어

translation.en: You must study strategy and tactics. Alexander and Caesar.
translation.ko: 전략과 전술을 공부해야 해 알렉산더와 시저를 연구해라

translation.en: Bayezid, I must speak to your father now.
Is my father dead?
We believe he's being held hostage by Vlad.
He's a monster.
How did you ever call him brother?
I promise to return with Hamza Bey.
When you find Vlad, make him suffer.
[narrator] On April 26, 1462, Mehmed sets off for Wallachia,
where the fate of one Ottoman hostage has already been decided.
translation.ko: 그곳에서 오스만 인질들의 운명은 이미 결정됐다

translation.en: -[strained grunts] -Don't worry, Katabolinos Pasha.

translation.ko: 너희 술탄이 곧 구하러 올 거야

translation.en: [narrator] And Vlad Dracula awaits.
